#Text=Tepoztlan
#Text=Tepoztlan is a popular tourist destination an hour south of Mexico City .
#Text=It 's famous for the El Tepezteco pyramid , which is on the summit of the nearby Tepezteco Mountain .
#Text=It 's also known for its spas , meditation , alternative medicine clinics and a very traditional city center .
#Text=It is a small town so you do n't need a car to travel within the city .
#Text=Get in
#Text=From Mexico City , you may take the metro to the Tasqueña station and follow the " autobuses " signs to the southern bus depot next door .
#Text=The various bus companies display their destinations and times .
#Text=Pullman de Morelos offers bus service every 30 minutes and a one-way ticket cost M$ 134 ( pesos ) in 2018 .
#Text=The bus ride is comfortable , scenic and takes about an hour and a half ( depending on traffic ) .
#Text=Upon arrival in Tepoztlan , the bus may drop you at a depot on the edge of town .
#Text=Taxis will be waiting to take you to the main square for M$ 40 .
#Text=Walking to the center will take 20-30 minutes or so .
#Text=The path to walk downtown is marked by a red metal guard rail across from the bus station .
#Text=Frequent buses run to and from the Adolfo Lopez Mateos market in Cuernavaca and pick up passengers along the way to the center of Tepoztlan .
#Text=About MX$ 20 .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Tepoztlan is a small quaint town and is easily walkable .
#Text=Most of the activity is centered around its main square and along the main avenue , Avenida 5 de mayo .
#Text=There is local bus service to surrounding towns .
#Text=See
#Text=There is an archeological site at the top of an easy-hikeable mountain ( assuming you are in decent shape -- there are 400m of stairs ) that is also famous for its " good vibrations " .
#Text=The hike can take up to 2 hours depending on your fitness level .
#Text=The pyramid , El Tepozteco , offers wonderful views of the surrounding area .
#Text=The site may be reached by walking down Avenida 5 de mayo ( in the direction away from where you entered the town ) .
#Text=Continue until the street ends to the steps which mark the beginning of the trail .
#Text=Make sure to bring water with you .
#Text=The hike to the top is free but it will cost M$ 37 ( in 2010 ) to access the pyramid .
#Text=At the top you will also encounter coati , also known as a tejón .
#Text=These animals , members of the raccoon family , are curious and will attempt to open backpacks to find food .
#Text=There is also a beautiful former convent called Dominico de la Navidad .
#Text=It has been restored and entrance is free .
#Text=It is located right off the main square .
#Text=If you are curious about it , the locals claim UFO sightings are common , which mostly just adds to the " new age " vibe of the town .
#Text=Ask about the " ovni " to hear strange tales .
#Text=Do
#Text=Temazcal is an ancient Mexican therapy that consists of a little igloo-shape room in which a group of people enter and medicinal plants are burned inside it and the place gets really warm .
#Text=A guide asks people to sing ancient songs to make the experience more complete .
#Text=Many hotels have this option either in groups or individual .
#Text=The Mexican Association of Scouts runs a large campground called Meztitla just outside of town .
#Text=The camp offers warm showers , tent camping , hiking , rock climbing , and rappel .
#Text=It is open to the public 365 days ( except for occasional closings due to special Scout events ) .
#Text=First-aid service is available .
#Text=There is an area for campfires .
#Text=Food services must be arranged in advance .
#Text=Mextitla ( in Spanish )
#Text=No visit to Tepoztlan would be complete without climbing Tepozteco to see the pyramid .
#Text=The Dominican monastery and museum is another must-see .
#Text=The building was damaged during the 2017 earthquake and may be closed at this time .
#Text=There is a small fee ( MX$ 10 ) to enter the monastery/museum .
#Text=The Pellicer Museum behind the monastery has an extensive collection of archaeological pieces .
#Text=The market is colorful and offers delicious local dishes .
#Text=It spreads out to cover an entire street on Sundays and is an excellent place to buy souvenirs .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There are many handicrafts sold in the market and nearby shops , as well as imported knickknacks from around the world .
#Text=Mezcal and quartz rocks are produced locally .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Tepoznieves has multiple locations around town ( Av. 5 de mayo , 21 ) and their ice cream is famous .
#Text=They may have up to 200 flavors available ranging from the pedestrian chocolate to more exotic rose petal , figs & mescal or carrot with chili .
#Text=La Posada de Tepoztec is located two blocks above the main square .
#Text=In addition to offering beautiful ( though pricey ) lodging , the restaurant serves delicious local cuisine .
#Text=Sit on the serene patio to enjoy the mountain and town views .
#Text=Their Chicken Mole is delicious .
#Text=Cuatecomate is a prehispanic restaurant .
#Text=It is located on Av Revolucion #10 , interior of Plaza las Flores .
#Text=El Ciruelo at Zaragoza #10 is a moderately-priced restaurant that features local food .
#Text=It is apt for vegetarians and vegans .
#Text=La Sombra del Sabino is a moderately-priced cafe near the toll booth at Revolucion #45 , Barrio San Jose .
#Text=It offers Mexican food for breakfast or afternoon dinner .
#Text=Many visitors choose to eat tacos , gorditas , and quesadillas in the market .
#Text=Flor de calabaza is quite popular .
#Text=Dried grasshoppers ( chapulines ) are also popular .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Tepoztēcatl was the god who invented pulque in Tepoztlan .
#Text=Pulques El Nectar Tepozteco , 62520 , Revolución de 1910 36 , San Miguel , Tepoztlán , ☏ +527393950212 .
#Text=Fri , Sat , Sun 10AM to 8 PM .
#Text=pulqueria MX$ 20 for 200 mL .
#Text=Pulques El Rey Tepozteco , Santisima Trinidad , 62520 Tepoztlán .
#Text=pulqueria
#Text=Lagartija Club Mezcal , Isabel La Católica 12 , San Miguel , 62520 Tepoztlán , ☏ +527393950196 .
#Text=Daily 12:30 - 19:30 ( Fri , Sat to 20:00 ) .
#Text=mezcal bar
#Text=Mezcalería La Cueva , Av. Revolución 2 , Santo Domingo , 62520 Tepoztlán .
#Text=Fri noon to midnight , Sat noon to 2AM , Sun noon to 11 PM .
#Text=mezcal bar with live music
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Sleeping in Tepoztlan can be noisy at times ( in December 2010 , the church bells seemed to ring on the half hour all night ) .
#Text=There are two campgrounds nearby : Camhomila ( YMCA camp ; accepts trailers and has cabins ) and Meztitla ( Scouts of Mexico , tents only ; hiking , rock climbing , rappel . )
#Text=Both nice , safe , and open to the public .
#Text=Posada Ali is nice place with a good view of the cliffs .
#Text=It costs around M$ 500 on weekdays ( prices seem to vary ) .
#Text=Amomoxtli , Calle Netzahualcóyotl 115 , Valle de Atongo , 62520 Tepoztlán ( 4 m from tollway , 3 km from ruins ) , ☏ +527393950012 .
#Text=Check-in : 3PM , check-out : 12 noon .
#Text=large gardens , suites , cabins , bar , swimming pool , wi-fi , spa MX$ 3,924 .

#Text=Its facilities and services include swimming pool , Shambhala restaurant , Sirio Holistic Spa and Feng Shui bioenergetic design .
